Question: To supplement his income and repay his debts, this person accepted independent commissions for at least nine houses.
Hints: Though most famous as an architect, this person was an active dealer in Japanese art, primarily ukiyo-e woodblock prints.
Both of this person's parents were strong-willed individuals with idiosyncratic interests that they passed on to him.
This person also designed many of the interior elements of his buildings, such as the furniture and stained glass.
